activity.title: coronasafe/care_fe#5140
activity.text:
@rithviknishad the components contaning the phone number field break while previewing a production build, I'm not able to pin point the actual issue but here's the error that I got 
```
Element type is invalid: expected a string (for built-in components) or a class/function (for composite components) but got: [missing argument].[missing argument]
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46787056/226797774-98d91a15-d127-4ebb-b63c-3021f1c7c23e.png)


please check this issue

activity.text: do not accept middleware address with scheme

activity.title: coronasafe/care#1199
activity.text:
> @sainak can you recheck the regex, even the valid URLs are failing
> 
> ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29787772/220268219-9815dfc2-ed52-4171-b8ba-af33f372ee6f.png)

That is the intended behavior because we use the same value for websockets in frontend as well, so saving it with scheme breaks the frontend requirement

activity.title: coronasafe/care_fe#4857
activity.text: This can be validated on the frontend itself the regex is `^(?!https?:\/\/)[a-zA-Z0-9_-]+(\.[a-zA-Z0-9_-]+)*\.[a-zA-Z]{2,}$`

activity.text: Endpoint for pin code details

activity.title: coronasafe/care#1107
activity.text:
I think this is what you are looking for:
```shell
curl -X 'GET' \
  'https://api.data.gov.in/resource/5c2f62fe-5afa-4119-a499-fec9d604d5bd?api-key=579b464db66ec23bdd00000115f15ab447b749065c58768a487d76bb&format=json&filters%5Bpincode%5D=400001' \
  -H 'accept: application/json'
```
ref: https://data.gov.in/apis/5c2f62fe-5afa-4119-a499-fec9d604d5bd
the public api key is good for upto 10 records per request so we can directly use this in the frontend

- make a model method to return extension or file type
